name: BunsenLabs Hydrogen
install_guide_markdown:
# BunsenLabs Hydrogen Installation Guide

## Prerequisites
- 512MB RAM minimum (1GB recommended)
- 4GB disk space
- USB drive (2GB+)
- Interest in lightweight, customizable Linux

## Step 1: Download ISO
Get Hydrogen ISO from bunsen-labs.org

## Step 2: Create Bootable USB
Use Etcher or dd command

## Step 3: Boot from USB
Restart and select USB from boot menu

## Step 4: Live Environment
Explore BunsenLabs before installing

## Step 5: Install to Disk
Follow installer for partitioning and configuration

## Step 6: Configure Desktop
Customize Openbox, panels, and keyboard shortcuts post-install

install_steps.title: Download BunsenLabs Hydrogen
install_steps.detail_md: Get ISO (1.2GB) from bunsen-labs.org or mirrors

install_steps.title: Create Bootable USB
install_steps.detail_md:
Write ISO to USB:
```
sudo dd if=BunsenLabs-Linux-Hydrogen-12.1-amd64.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M
```

install_steps.title: Boot Live Environment
install_steps.detail_md: Insert USB and reboot. Select USB from boot menu. Explore the lightweight Openbox desktop.

install_steps.title: Launch Installer
install_steps.detail_md: Double-click Calamares installer icon or run from terminal.

install_steps.title: Configure Partitions
install_steps.detail_md: Choose automatic (simple) or manual partitioning for more control.

install_steps.title: Create User Account
install_steps.detail_md: Set hostname, timezone, root password, and create regular user.

install_steps.title: Install BunsenLabs
install_steps.detail_md: Click Install to write system to disk (10-15 minutes).

install_steps.title: Customize Openbox
install_steps.detail_md: Edit ~/.config/openbox/rc.xml to customize keybindings and behavior.
